intro: Alyssum orbelicum, commonly known as sweet alyssum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces clusters of flowers at the tips of its branches. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a silvery-gray appearance due to a dense covering of fine hairs. Alyssum orbelicum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
